did.head: Descriptive Summary

did.abstract: The collection consists of two letters written by "Mark," a Confederate cavalryman, to his father in 1861.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was purchased by Special Collections in December 2011.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Cavalryman's Correspondence was completed in June 2012.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: As the two letters in this collection are simply signed "Mark," it is unclear who the author is or which Virginia cavalry unit(s) he served in.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of two letters written by "Mark," a Confederate cavalryman, to his father. The first is dated June 26, 1861, from Orange County Courthouse in Orange County, Va., and the second is dated August 19, 1861, from Leesburg, Va. Both letters detail camp life, cavalry unit activities, and general war news.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in chronological order.
